Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.common

Class GameHandler

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.common.GameHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameHandler extends Object implements Serializable
Handles the game logic and state for the EISC Uno game. This class manages players, deck, table, and game flow.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameHandler

      public GameHandler(Player human, Player machine, Deck deck, Table table, boolean iaSaidUno, boolean isHumanTurn, boolean humanSaidUno, Runnable updateVisualCallback, Runnable resetCardScroll)
      Constructs a GameHandler with the specified players, deck, table, and game state.
      Parameters:
      human - The human player.
      machine - The machine player.
      deck - The deck of cards.
      table - The table where cards are played.
      iaSaidUno - Indicates if the AI has said UNO.
      isHumanTurn - Indicates if it's the human player's turn.
      humanSaidUno - Indicates if the human player has said UNO.
      updateVisualCallback - Callback to update the visual representation of the game.
      resetCardScroll - Callback to reset card scrolling in the UI.

  • Method Details

    • createNewGame

      public static GameHandler createNewGame(Runnable updateVisualCallback, Runnable resetCardScroll)
      Creates a new game with default players, deck, and table.
      Parameters:
      updateVisualCallback - Callback to update the visual representation of the game.
      resetCardScroll - Callback to reset card scrolling in the UI.
      Returns:
      A new instance of GameHandler.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by dealing cards to players and setting the initial card on the table. Deals 5 cards to the human player and 5 cards to the machine player. The initial card on the table is a non-special card.

    • eatCard

      public void eatCard(Player player, int numberOfCards)
      Eats a specified number of cards from the deck and adds them to the player's hand. If the deck is empty, it refills the deck with cards in use before taking cards.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will receive the cards.
      numberOfCards - The number of cards to take from the deck.

    • handleHumanCardClick

      public boolean handleHumanCardClick(Card card, Runnable onFinish)
      Handles the click event on a human player's card. Validates if the card can be played on the current card on the table. If valid, plays the card, applies its effect, and checks for a winner. If the card is not a special card, it passes the turn to the machine player.
      Parameters:
      card - The card clicked by the human player.
      onFinish - A callback to run after handling the card click.
      Returns:
      true if the card was played successfully, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentVisibleCardsHumanPlayer

      public Card[] getCurrentVisibleCardsHumanPlayer(int posInitCardToShow)
      Gets the current visible cards for the human player starting from a specified position. The cards are reversed to show the most recent cards first.
      Parameters:
      posInitCardToShow - The starting position of the card to show.
      Returns:
      An array of visible cards for the human player.

    • hasPlayableCard

      public boolean hasPlayableCard(Player player)
      Checks if the player has any playable card based on the current card on the table.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check for playable cards.
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least one playable card, false otherwise.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(Player player, Card card)
      Plays a card from the player's hand and updates the game state. The card is added to the table, removed from the player's hand, and the visual representation is updated.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is playing the card.
      card - The card to be played.

    • applyCardEffectAndTurn

      public void applyCardEffectAndTurn(Card card, boolean playedByHuman)
      Applies the effect of the played card and updates the game state. Handles special cards like +2, +4, wild cards, skip, and reverse. Updates the turn based on whether the card was played by a human or machine player.
      Parameters:
      card - The card that was played.
      playedByHuman - Indicates if the card was played by the human player.

    • setColorChooser

      public void setColorChooser(ColorChooser colorChooser)
      Sets the color chooser for selecting colors when playing wild cards.
      Parameters:
      colorChooser - The ColorChooser instance to set.

    • checkWinner

      public String checkWinner()
      Checks if there is a winner in the game. If the human player has no cards left, they win. If the machine player has no cards left, they win. Updates the game state accordingly and returns the winner.
      Returns:
      The type of the winner ("HUMAN" or "MACHINE"), or null if no winner yet.

    • getLastCard

      public Card getLastCard(Player player)
      Gets the last card played by the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose last card is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The last card played by the player, or null if the player has no cards.

      public Card getCurrentCardOnTable()

      public Player getHumanPlayer()

      public Player getMachinePlayer()
